member.name: T:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.CommaType
member.summary: Can specify whether to add commas before or after a token during code generation.

member.name: F:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.CommaType.Before
member.summary: Place a comma before the token.

member.name: F:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.CommaType.After
member.summary: Place a comma after the token.

member.name: T:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.Sentence
member.summary: Represents a set of items related to code generation. A sentence contains multiple tokens. Tokens are represented as objects, but you can use any class, value, or structure. The objects' ToString() values are treated as their code. However, a few types are treated as having special meaning: TokenAsyn, TokenName, and TokenSeparator.

member.name: P:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.Sentence.Owner
member.summary: Returns the generator that generated the sentence.

member.name: T:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.TokenAsync
member.summary: Asynchronous token. When this token is included, an Async object will be used when a situation is deemed to need asynchronous execution . Please use DebugMode class if you want to check the operations related to this token during tests while the generator is attached.

member.name: T:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.GeneratorBase
member.summary: Generator base class. All generators must inherit this class. If you define a child class and create a mapping to the target controls using the plugin XML format, the class will be instantiated in the target application and have Attach() called during the "generate code from interactions" operation.

member.name: M:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.GeneratorBase.AddSentence(System.Object[])
member.param: Tokens to be included in the sentence.

member.name: M:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.GeneratorBase.Attach
member.summary: Attach operation. Causes the test object to attach to the target window. Also attaches events in the case of .NET windows.

member.name: M:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.GeneratorBase.Detach
member.summary: Detach operation. Detaches the test object from the window. Also disconnects events in the case of .NET windows.

member.name: P:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.GeneratorBase.WindowHandle
member.summary: Target window handle of the code generation. Returns IntPtr.Zero for WPF controls.

member.name: P:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.GeneratorBase.ControlObject
member.summary: Target control object of the code generation operation. Returns null for native windows.

member.name: P:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.GeneratorBase.Name
member.summary: Variable name that is assigned to the control by TestAssistant.

member.name: T:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.DebugMode
member.summary: When used in a generator during tests, allows running in debug mode. Can also be used to force running in async mode.

member.name: P:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.DebugMode.IsAllAsync
member.summary: Flag to indicate generating all tests in asynchronous mode.

member.name: T:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.TokenSeparator
member.summary: A separator token. Can be added as the only token in a Sentence to produce a blank line. Optimized to a single line when multiple TokenSeparators occur together.

member.name: T:Codeer.TestAssistant.GeneratorToolKit.TokenName
member.summary: A name token. Used as a variable name when added to a generator.
